Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async repository.contacts.birthdays_in_7_days(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
The birthdays_in_7_days function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.

User is the current logged in user who’s contacts will be returned.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of records from the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • user – User is the current logged in user who’s contacts will be returned.

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days

async repository.contacts.check_contact(email: str, phone: str, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The check_contact function checks if a contact already exists in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Check if the email is already in use by another user

  • phone – str: Check if the phone number is already in the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object if the email or phone number is already in database

async repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactBase: Pass the contact data from the request body to create_contact

  • user – User: Get the user id from the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

async repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The get_contact function takes in a contact_id and returns the contact with that id from database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be retrieved

  • user – User: Get the user id from the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact with the given id

async repository.contacts.get_contacts(first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts that match the given parameters.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Filter the contacts by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Filter the contacts by email

  • skip – int: Skip a number of records

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • user – User: Get the user id from the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function.

Returns:

A list of matching contacts

async repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be removed

  • user – User: Get the user id from the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was removed

async repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactBase, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The update_contact function takes in a contact_id and updates the contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify which contact to update

  • body – ContactBase: Pass the data from the request body to this function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated contact or none if no contact was found

REST API repository Users¶

async repository.users.confirm_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirm_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user’s email address

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

async repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database with parameters include in UserModel.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass the user data to the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function returns the user with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the user you want to get from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user with the given email

async repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – Pass the email of the user for whom the avatar will be changed

  • url – str: Pass in the url of the avatar image

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

async repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Set the refresh token for a user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function
